meanings.definition: Used to refer to a woman or girl as the object of a verb or preposition when she is also the subject of the clause.
meanings.sent3: She found herself in a funny situation.
meanings.sent4: She pushed herself to the limit.
meanings.sent5: She painted herself into a corner.

meanings.definition: Used for emphasis or to refer to a woman or girl as the object of a verb or preposition when she is the subject of the clause.
meanings.sent2: She dressed herself in a beautiful gown.
meanings.sent3: She surprised herself with a silly joke.
meanings.sent4: She shone like a star herself.
meanings.sent5: She believed in herself against all odds.
